definitions.definition: to give something to somebody and receive something in exchange
definitions.sensetop: swap (something) (with somebody)swap something for somethingswap something

examples.text: I've finished this magazine. Can I swap with you?
I swapped my red scarf for her blue one.
Can we **swap places**? I can't see the screen.
We spent the evening in the pub **swapping stories** *(= telling each other stories)* about our travels.

definitions.definition: to start doing somebody else’s job, etc. while they do yours

examples.text: I'll drive there and then we'll swap over on the way back.

definitions.definition: to replace one person or thing with another

examples.text: I think I'll swap this sweater for one in another colour.
I'm going to swap you over. Mike will go first and Jon will go second.

definitions.definition: to be in somebody else’s situation

examples.text: I'm perfectly happy—I wouldn't change places with anyone.

wordOrigin: Middle English (originally in the sense ‘throw forcibly’): probably imitative of a resounding blow. Current senses have arisen from an early use meaning ‘strike hands as a token of agreement’.
